page.title: 06POST OFFICE
page.content: The Gilmerton Post Office and small shop, located at the most western side of the settlement, is essential to the community as it is the sole supplier in the village. It supplies pensions and groceries to those who cannot travel and convenience goods to other village inhabitants. As a shop it sells limited groceries, newspapers,cigarettes and sweets. Some of the prices of the goods in the shop are slightly higher than in Crieff, but this is compensated for by the saving in the bus fare. The shop is also used by passing traffic as it is situated on the side of the main road. Mrs. McKenzie, who has run the Post Office for 20 years, runs it mainly herself but in the summer season employees some extra help when there is more passing trade.
